title: ds.security_event_episode_core_v1
description: Core security episode schema for MOVA: records a security-relevant event with policy reference, severity, and recommended/actual actions.

episode_type.description: Episode type must indicate a security event. Convention: security_event[/subtype], where subtype normally matches a security_event_type id.

security_event_type.description: Concrete type of security event. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_event_type[*].id (e.g. prompt_injection_suspected), or a namespaced custom type (vendorX:custom_event) if extended.

security_event_category.description: High-level category for grouping security events.

severity.description: Severity of the event from the security perspective.

policy_profile_id.description: Identifier of the security policy profile that applies, e.g. mova_security_default_v1. Should match an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_policy_profile[*].id.

policy_ref.description: Optional reference to the concrete policy document/rule that was triggered.

policy_document_id.description: Identifier or URL of the policy document.

rule_id.description: Identifier of the concrete rule or clause inside the policy.

policy_version.description: Version of the policy used for this evaluation.

security_model_version.description: Version of the MOVA security model used when producing this episode, e.g. 1.0.0. Should match the security_model_version of the referenced policy profile in global.security_catalog_v1.

detection_source.description: Where this security event came from: human_review, rule_engine, runtime_guard, external_system, other.

detection_confidence.description: Confidence in this event being correctly detected, from 0.0 to 1.0.

recommended_actions.description: List of recommended actions in response to this security event.

action_type.description: Type of recommended action, e.g. log, alert, block, fallback. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_action_type[*].id.

reason.description: Short human-readable explanation why this action is recommended.

actions_taken.description: List of actions that were actually taken in response to this security event.

action_type.description: Type of action taken. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_action_type[*].id.

actor.description: Actor that executed the action (service id, user id, tool id, etc.).

details.description: Optional human-readable details about this action.
